column4: hm. good to see that it is not only java developers who get "deprecated" wrong all the time. ;)
its deprecation or what win32 has become :)
win32, deprecated? funk, nobody told me. i need to tell my boss, we need to cancel the current project. :)
Its not. It should. :)
ah, perhaps, like any c level api :)
do you run nautilus in browser mode?
I dont think there is a side-pane in nautilus default mode
aha. the goal is to have that helpful tree view. the side pane seems to be able to display that, that got me the idea to open it...
correct
i don't know what mode it is in. how do i find out?
System -> Settings -> File Manager -> Behaviour -> Always use Browser
(my Gnome is not english, so it's not 100% correct)

i see. sucks not to have the english variant, makes communication hard. which is why i installed the english variant. unfortunately it defaults to english keyboard layout then. makes entering more special chars a challenge...:|
but you did enable the browser mode?
i cannot find something called "system" already. there is Computer/"System Configuration"
top menu bar, "Computer", "System Configuration", is that what you are refering to?
ah, firing up nautilus with "nautilus --browser" did the job. thank you.
ah, thank you.
gdm usually shows the error msg when it fails though
gnome-vfs now uses a user-space mount thingie, so it's in /tmp somewhere
i see
